results.title: Eclipse '73
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Dassonville and Service du film de Research Scientifique
results.brief_description: A report on the solar eclipse of June 30, 1973 seen from the ground and from a plane. The 1973 eclipse was monitored in Africa, south of the Sahara. Deals with the considerable means employed by the international scientific community while showing the mechanics of an eclipse and its value for basic research. At Atar in the heart of the Mauritanian desert together with other Soviet, Japanese, Dutch and Italian scientists, the French mission brought in more than 20 tons of equipment, and used the most advanced technological means. The use of a supersonic Concorde 001, especially equipped by aerospace for this flight enabled them for the first time to monitor an eclipse for 74 minutes.

results.title: Eat Art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Play Printing”.
Backed by modern music, a group of painters silently act out movements as they create a mural piece by piece. The artwork takes form as the mural is placed on the wall until the completed artwork is seen to be food spread out on a checked tablecloth

results.title: Easter Island
results.creator_credit: Coleman Film Enterprises and Southwestern Educational Films
results.brief_description: Study of the land, the people and the strange history of Easter Island, a Pacific Island famous for its giant mysterious figures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Earthlings can do anything
results.brief_description: This is a video package for upper primary school students which can be used in a number of curriculum areas, most appropriately for science/technology studies and careers/personal development. The emphasis is on developing the talents and skills of girls in traditional male dominated curriculum areas.

results.title: Earth is a battlefield
results.creator_credit: Dick Taylor, Geoffrey Sumner and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: A light-hearted history of the contribution steel has made to world food supplies and the importance of exports made from steel in paying for imported food. Original animation techniques, with a good musical score and a commentary of rhyming couplets make for a delightful and useful film. Animation by Beryl Stevens and others
